p: For tetracycline hydrochloride, the conjugated trione system (involving the amide group) is responsible for pKa 1 = 3.3 [ 52]. The weakly basic conjugated phenolic enone system becomes involved at pH = 7.3, owing for a 25% decrease in the value of the tetracycline diffusion coefficients, compared to pH = 3. The amino groups become ionized only at pH > 8, which is well outside the pH thresholds for the human body.
